education_text.0: Pausch learned he had      Pancreatic cancer pancreatic cancer in September 2006Pausch was an assistant and associate professor in the Department of Computer Science at the      University of Virginia University of Virginia's School of Engineering and Applied Science from 1988 until 1997Pausch was an assistant and associate professor in the Department of Computer Science at the      University of Virginia University of Virginia's School of Engineering and Applied Science from 1988 until 1997Pausch was an assistant and associate professor in the Department of Computer Science at the      University of Virginia University of Virginia's School of Engineering and Applied Science from 1988 until 1997Pausch delivered his  Last Lecture , titled  Really Achieving Your Childhood Dreams , at CMU on September 18, 2007During the lecture, Pausch offered inspirational life lessons, and performed ups on stageCMU president      Jared Cohon Jared Cohon spoke emotionally of Pausch's humanity and called his contributions to the university and to education  remarkable and stunning Pausch gave a lecture about      Time management time management          on November 27, 2007, at the University of Virginia, to an audience of over 850 peoplePausch gave a lecture about      Time management time management          on November 27, 2007, at the University of Virginia, to an audience of over 850 people
